intro: Fagara ovatifoliolata, commonly known as the broad-leafed fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, ovate leaves with a prominently veined structure and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Fagara ovatifoliolata typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical forest ecosystems.
